title: Disease assessment
text:
207 experimental units means a lot of disease observation to do ! what is the best compromise between time spent and precision of observations ?







EPPO Standard
FAST assessment




% of bunch with powdery mildew
Class [0-5] of powdery mildew on bunches







81 observed units (40%)
50 bunches/unit : 4050 obs
9 persons
27 working hours
20 min/unit


207 observed units (on both sides)
10 vinestocks/unit : 4140 observation
6 persons
18 working hours
5.2 min/unit (4 times faster)

title: Introduction
text:
Welcome in this Precision spraying and Biospraytech demo !
UMT ECOTECH aims at developping precision spraying for optimising application of products : quantity, way to target the crop, coverage and water volumes. Biospraytech is our program to use precision spraying for assessing the most appropriate methods and sprayers settings to spray biocontrol and obtain protection programs that meet the Green Deal objectives. This is On Farm Precision Experiment.
Vegetation maps such as made from mobile 2D Lidar measurements can be used in the process. The prototype prepared by Berthoud and Optima to support this program can control each individual nozzle with a centrimetric precision on the vertical boom according to requirements provided in a map.
Demo : A map will be uploaded in the sprayer and the participants will see change of flow rate at nozzles when the sprayer moves from one place to another.

title: Modulation map creation
text:
The modulation map is created from the experimental design map, where each experimental unit is a section of a grapevine row with a specific spray pattern and a specific PPP dose. The modulation map defines geographic polygons with volume rate instruction for each nozzle of the sprayer.



Nozzle numbers


The nozzle volume rate instructions in each polygon depend on the sprayer direction.



Modulation map creation

title: Experimental design
text:
In this experiment, 2 factors were tested :

the dose of phytosanitary products : from 0.7 to 2x the reference dose (1N)
the spray pattern :
